word: I have been shown that some men worked with Eld. Smith, in an underhanded manner, in order to lead him to place the lowest possible royalties on his books. Eld. Smith was deceived in the object of these men; he thought that they were really trying to advance the case of God; and they obtained their desire. Then they came to me and to others, telling us that Bro. Smith only received so much for his books, and urging that the canvassers would rather handle books that would sell rapidly.
